abstract: BP says it plans to sell more assets and increase investment in exploration as it rebounds from the 2010 disaster in the Gulf of Mexico; reports earnings of $5.3 billion in the third quarter, down 3.7 percent from $5.5 billion a year earlier; net income rose to $4.9 billion from $1.8 billion.
snippet: The British oil company said it planned to sell more assets and increase investment in exploration as it rebounds from the 2010 oil spill disaster.
lead_paragraph: The British oil company said it planned to sell more assets and increase investment in exploration as it rebounds from the 2010 oil spill disaster.

headline.main: BP Earnings Slip 3.7% on Lower Production
headline.print_headline: BP Plans to Sell More Assets, as Earnings Fall on Lower Production
